translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on Pairs, the Schedule in Pairs

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sa hetuka duka
translated: The Section on the Dyads with Root-Cause

original: Hetu🔽Nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— vicikicchāsahagataṁ🔽uddhaccasahagataṁ mohaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ paṭicca tayo
analyzed: hetu  na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagata  uddhacca sahagatam moham paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpe ekam mahābhūtam paṭicca tayo

original: mahābhūtā …pe… dve mahābhūte paṭicca dve mahābhūtā, mahābhūte paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ🔽rūpaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ. Nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā— vicikicchāsahagataṁ uddhaccasahagataṁ mohaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā;
analyzed: mahābhūtā pe dve mahābhūte paṭicca dve mahābhūtā mahābhūte paṭicca citta samuṭṭhāna  rūpam kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpa na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagatam uddhacca sahagatam moham paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: With root-cause as condition, a root-cause arises that is without root-cause. With doubt and with agitation and with ignorance as condition, the materiality originated by consciousness arises. With one great primary as condition, three great primaries … With two great primaries as condition, two great primaries. With the great primaries as condition, the materiality originated by consciousness, the materiality originated by temperature, the materiality originated by kamma. With a root-cause as condition, a root-cause arises that is without root-cause.🔽With doubt and with agitation and with ignorance as condition, the states associated therewith arise.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, with the physical basis as condition, the root-causes and the states associated therewith arise. With a root-cause as condition, a root-cause arises that is without root-cause, and also with root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause arises.🔽With doubt and with agitation and with ignorance as condition, the states associated therewith arise.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca sahetukā khandhā. Nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko🔽ca naahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca sa hetukā khandhāḥ na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ 🔽ca na ahetukaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, with the physical basis as condition, the root-causes and the states associated therewith arise.

original: Naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nasahetukañca naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nasahetukañca naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na sahetukam ca na ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na sahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na sahetukam ca na ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an uncaused dhamma as condition, an uncaused dhamma arises … three …🔽With a caused and an uncaused dhamma as condition, an uncaused dhamma arises …🔽With a caused and an uncaused dhamma as condition, an uncaused dhamma arises …

original: Nasahetukañca naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko ca naahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: na sahetukam ca na ahetukam ca dhammam paṭicca na sahetukaḥ ca na ahetukaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti
translated: With an uncaused condition … a caused and an uncaused condition … a caused condition … an uncaused condition … a caused and an uncaused condition …

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetu paccayā  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate nava
sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam evam vitthāretabba
translated: With a cause, nine; with object, six; with predominance, five … (as in §10) … with non-hindrance, nine.🔽(The section on origination should be expanded as in §10.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa🔽Nasahetuko dhammo nasahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Nasahetuko dhammo
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa  na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ na sa hetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ

original: naahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Nasahetuko dhammo nasahetukassa ca
analyzed: na ahetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na sahetukaḥ dhammaḥ na sahetukassa ca
translated: A caused condition is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an uncaused state. A caused condition is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an uncaused state. A caused condition is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an uncaused state and for a caused state.

analyzed: na ahetukassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and a causally-conditioned phenomenon is a condition, as a cause condition, for a causally-unconditioned phenomenon.

original: Naahetuko dhammo naahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ na ahetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A causally-unconditioned phenomenon is a condition, as a cause condition, for a causally-unconditioned phenomenon. … three.

original: Nasahetuko dhammo nasahetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ na sa hetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A causally-unrelated phenomenon is a condition, as a object condition, for a causally-unrelated phenomenon. (Abbreviated.)🔽As a cause six, as object nine, as predominance four, as proximity nine, … as conascence nine,

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare nava …pe… sahajāte nava,🔽aññamaññe cha, nissaye upanissaye nava, purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane nava, kamme
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā cattāri anantare nava pe sahajāte nava  aññamaññe cha nissaye upanissaye nava purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane nava kamme
translated: as mutuality six, as support nine, as foundation nine, as prenascence three, as postnascence three, as repetition nine, as kamma four,

original: …pe… jhāne cattāri, magge tīṇi, sampayutte cha, vippayutte pañca …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: pe jhāne cattāri magge tīṇi sampayutte cha vippayutte pañca pe avigate nava
translated: … as jhāna four, as path three, as association six, as dissociation five, … as absence five, as disappearance five, as adverting five, as resolve five, as registration five, as non-causality five, as root five, as non-disappearance five, as presence five, as root-cause five, as faculty five, as power five, as enlightenment factor five, as path factor five, as fruition five, as path five, as Nibbāna five.
(The section on the questions should be elaborated in detail here in the same way as in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness.)
